intro: Babiana densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered babiana, is a South African plant belonging to the Iridaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, grass-like foliage and produces dense clusters of bright yellow flowers during the summer months. The plant is native to the Western Cape region and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is often found in rocky outcrops and coastal areas, where it adapts well to full sun exposure. Babiana densiflora is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its ornamental value and low maintenance requirements.
